doc.author: Gomathi Selvi Srinivasan (@GomathiselviS)
doc.description: This module configures and manages the attributes of ospfv2 on Arista EOS platforms.
notes: This module works with connection C(network_cli). See the L(EOS Platform Options,../network/user_guide/platform_eos.html).

config.description: A list of configurations for ospfv2.

processes.description: A list of dictionary specifying the ospfv2 processes.

adjacency.description: Configure adjacency options for OSPF instance.

exchange_start.description: Configure exchange-start options for OSPF instance.

threshold.description: Number of peers to bring up simultaneously.

areas.description: Specifies the configuration for OSPF areas

area_id.description: Specifies a 32 bit number expressed in decimal or dotted-decimal notation.

default_cost.description: Specify the cost for default summary route in stub/NSSA area.

filter.description: Specify the filter for incoming summary LSAs.

prefix_list.description: Specify list to filter for incoming LSAs.

nssa_only.description: Limit default advertisement to this NSSA area.

no_summary.description: Filter all type-3 LSAs in the nssa area.

nssa_only.description: Limit default advertisement to this NSSA area.

no_summary.description: Filter all type-3 LSAs in the nssa area.
If False , Filter all type-3 LSAs in the stub area.

set.description: When true sets the stub config alone.

reference_bandwidth.description: reference bandwidth in megabits per sec.

default_metric.description: Configure the default metric for redistributed routes

distance.description: Specifies the administrative distance for routes.

distribute_list.description: Specifies the list of routes to be filtered.

dn_bit_ignore.description: If True, Disable dn-bit check for Type-3 LSAs in non-default VRFs.

grace_period.description: Specify maximum time to wait for graceful-restart to complete.

set.description: When true sets the grace_fulrestart config alone.

graceful_restart_helper.description: If True, Enable graceful restart helper.

log_adjacency_changes.description: To configure link-state changes and transitions of OSPFv2 neighbors.

detail.description: If true , configures the switch to log all link-state changes.

max_lsa.description: Specifies the switch behavior on reaching max lsa count.

ignore_count.description: No. of times the switch can shut down temporarily on warning

ignore_time.description: time in minutes, for which the switch shoud be shutdown on max-lsa warning

reset_time.description: Time in minutes, after which the shutdown counter resets.

threshold.description: percentage of <count> , when a warning should be raised.

warning.description: Only give warning message when limit is exceeded

external_lsa.description: Override external-lsa metric with max-metric value.

description: Set max metric value for external LSAs.

include_stub.description: Set maximum metric for stub links in router-LSAs.

on_startup.description: Set maximum metric temporarily after reboot.

description: Wait period in seconds after startup.

summary_lsa.description: Override summary-lsa metric with max-metric value.

description: Set max metric value for external LSAs.

maximum_paths.description: Maximum number of next-hops in an ECMP route.

passive_interface.description: Include interface but without actively running OSPF.

default.description: If True, Set all interfaces to passive by default

redistribute.description: Specifies the routes to be redistributed

route_map.description: Specify which route map to use.

rfc1583compatibility.description: Specifies different methods for calculating summary route metrics.

router_id.description: 32-bit number assigned to a router running OSPFv2.

initial.description: Delay to generate first occurrence of LSA in msecs.

max.description: Maximum delay between originating the same LSA in msecs.

min.description: Min delay between originating the same LSA in msecs.

initial.description: Initial SPF schedule delay in msecs.

max.description: Max wait time between two SPFs in msecs.

min.description: Min Hold time between two SPFs in msecs

description: This option is used only with state I(parsed).
The value of this option should be the output received from the EOS device by executing the command B(show running-config | section ospf).

The state I(parsed) reads the configuration from C(running_config) option and transforms it into Ansible structured data as per the resource module's argspec and the value is then returned in the I(parsed) key within the result.
The state the configuration should be left in.

arista.eos.eos_ospfv2.examples:
# Using merged

# Before state:
# ------------
# localhost#show running-config | section ospf
# localhost#

  - name: replace Ospf configs
    arista.eos.eos_ospfv2:
      config:
        - processes:
            - process_id: 1
              adjacency:
                exchange_start:
                    threshold: 20045623
              areas:
                - filter:
                    address: "10.1.1.0/24"
                  id: "0.0.0.2"
                - id: "0.0.0.50"
                  range:
                    address: "172.20.0.0/16"
                    cost: 34
              default_information:
                metric: 100
                metric_type: 1
                originate: True
              distance:
                intra_area: 85
              max_lsa:
                count: 8000
                ignore_count: 3
                ignore_time: 6
                reset_time: 20
                threshold: 40
              networks:
                - area: "0.0.0.0"
                  prefix: 10.10.2.0/24
                - area: "0.0.0.0"
                  prefix: "10.10.3.0/24"
              redistribute:
                - routes: "static"
              router_id: "170.21.0.4"
            - process_id: 2
              vrf: "vrf01"
              areas:
                - id: "0.0.0.9"
                  default_cost: 20
              max_lsa:
                count: 8000
                ignore_count: 3
                ignore_time: 6
                reset_time: 20
                threshold: 40
              networks:
                - area: "0.0.0.0"
                  prefix: 10.10.2.0/24
                - area: "0.0.0.0"
                  prefix: "10.10.3.0/24"
              redistribute:
                - routes: "static"
              router_id: "170.21.0.4"
            - process_id: 2
              vrf: "vrf01"
              areas:
                - id: "0.0.0.9"
                  default_cost: 20
              max_lsa:
                count: 8000
                ignore_count: 3
                ignore_time: 6
                reset_time: 20
                threshold: 40
            - process_id: 3
              vrf: "vrf02"
              redistribute:
                - routes: "connected"

# After state:

# router ospf 1
#    router-id 170.21.0.4
#    distance ospf intra-area 85
#    redistribute static

  - name: replace Ospf configs
    arista.eos.eos_ospfv2:
          config:
            - processes:
                - process_id: 2
                  vrf: "vrf01"
                  point_to_point: True
                  redistribute:
                    - routes: "isis"
                      isis_level: "level-1"

          state: replaced

  - name: override Ospf configs
    arista.eos.eos_ospfv2:
          config:
            - processes:
                - process_id: 2
                  vrf: "vrf01"
                  redistribute:
                    - routes: "connected"

          state: override

          config:
            - processes:
                - process_id: 1

          state: deleted

#                         "threshold": 40
#                     },
#                     "process_id": 2,
#                     "redistribute": [
#                         {
#                             "routes": "connected"
#                         }
#                     ],
#                     "vrf": "vrf01"
#                 },
#                 {
#                     "max_lsa": {
#                         "count": 12000
#                     },
#                     "process_id": 3,
#                     "redistribute": [
#                         {
#                             "routes": "connected"
#                         }
#                     ],
#                     "vrf": "vrf02"
#                 }
#             ]
#         }
#     ]

# Using parsed:
# ------------

# parsed.cfg
# router ospf 1
#    adjacency exchange-start threshold 20045623
#    area 0.0.0.2 filter 10.1.1.0/24
#    area 0.0.0.50  range 172.20.0.0/16 cost 34
#    default-information originate  metric 100 metric-type 1
#    distance ospf intra-area 85
#    max-lsa  80000 40 ignore-count 3  ignore-time 6  reset-time 20
#    network 10.10.2.0/24 area 0.0.0.0
#    network 10.10.3.0/24 area 0.0.0.0
#    redistribute static
#    router-id 170.21.0.4
# router ospf 2 vrf vrf01,
#    area 0.0.0.9 default-cost 20
#    max-lsa  80000 40 ignore-count 3  ignore-time 6  reset-time 20
# router ospf 3 vrf vrf02
#    redistribute static

  - name: Parse Ospf configs
    arista.eos.eos_ospfv2:
          running_config: "{{ lookup('file', './parsed.cfg') }}"
          state: parsed

# "parsed": [
#         {
#             "processes": [
#                 {
#                     "adjacency": {
#                         "exchange_start": {
#                             "threshold": 20045623
#                         }
#                     },
#                     "areas": [
#                         {
#                             "filter": {
#                                 "address": "10.1.1.0/24"
#                             },
#                             "id": "0.0.0.2"
#                         },
#                         {
#                             "id": "0.0.0.50",
#                             "range": {
#                                 "address": "172.20.0.0/16",
#                                 "cost": 34
#                             }
#                         }
#                     ],
#                     "default_information": {
#                         "metric": 100,
#                         "metric_type": 1,
#                         "originate": true
#                     },
#                     "distance": {
#                         "intra_area": 85
#                     },
#                     "max_lsa": {
#                         "count": 80000,
#                         "ignore_count": 3,
#                         "ignore_time": 6,
#                         "reset_time": 20,
#                         "threshold": 40
#                     },
#                     "networks": [
#                         {
#                             "area": "0.0.0.0",
#                             "prefix": "10.10.2.0/24"
#                         },
#                         {
#                             "area": "0.0.0.0",
#                             "prefix": "10.10.3.0/24"
#                         }
#                     ],
#                     "process_id": 1,
#                     "redistribute": [
#                         {
#                             "routes": "static"
#                         }
#                     ],
#                     "router_id": "170.21.0.4"
#                 },
#                 {
#                     "areas": [
#                         {
#                             "default_cost": 20,
#                             "id": "0.0.0.9"
#                         }
#                     ],
#                     "max_lsa": {
#                         "count": 80000,
#                         "ignore_count": 3,
#                         "ignore_time": 6,
#                         "reset_time": 20,
#                         "threshold": 40
#                     },
#                     "process_id": 2,
#                     "vrf": "vrf01,"
#                 },
#                 {
#                     "process_id": 3,
#                     "redistribute": [
#                         {
#                             "routes": "static"
#                         }
#                     ],
#                     "vrf": "vrf02"
#                 }
#             ]
#         }
#     ]

# Using rendered:
# --------------

  - name: replace Ospf configs
    arista.eos.eos_ospfv2:
          config:
            - processes:
              - process_id: 1
                adjacency:
                  exchange_start:
                    threshold: 20045623
                areas:
                - filter:
                    address: 10.1.1.0/24
                  id: 0.0.0.2
                - id: 0.0.0.50
                  range:
                    address: 172.20.0.0/16
                    cost: 34
                default_information:
                  metric: 100
                  metric_type: 1
                  originate: true
                distance:
                  intra_area: 85
                max_lsa:
                  count: 8000
                  ignore_count: 3
                  ignore_time: 6
                  reset_time: 20
                  threshold: 40
                networks:
                - area: 0.0.0.0
                  prefix: 10.10.2.0/24
                - area: 0.0.0.0
                  prefix: 10.10.3.0/24
                redistribute:
                - routes: static
                router_id: 170.21.0.4
          state: rendered

# "rendered": [
#         "router ospf 1",
#         "adjacency exchange-start threshold 20045623",
#         "area 0.0.0.2 filter 10.1.1.0/24",
#         "area 0.0.0.50  range 172.20.0.0/16 cost 34",
#         "default-information originate metric 100 metric-type 1",
#         "distance ospf intra-area 85",
#         "max-lsa  8000 40 ignore-count 3  ignore-time 6  reset-time 20",
#         "network 10.10.2.0/24 area 0.0.0.0",
#         "network 10.10.3.0/24 area 0.0.0.0",
#         "redistribute static",
#         "router-id 170.21.0.4"
#     ]
#

after.sample:
The configuration returned will always be in the same format
 of the parameters above.

before.description: The configuration prior to the model invocation.
before.sample:
The configuration returned will always be in the same format
 of the parameters above.

commands.description: The set of commands pushed to the remote device.
